title: Poster, "Déja vu by now man (not so) kind should know...", ca. 1985
medium: Offset lithograph on textured white wove paper
inscribed:
Imprinted in white, yellow and red across sheet at lower edge: by NOw man [NOt so] kind should kNOw that peace is NOt defined with war. war makes NO sense. (NO printed in yellow throughout). Imprinted in blue and black upper right corner: concept: the V man/photos corinne pfister
Verso: Imprinted in black across lower edge of sheet: a public lecture for artists and designers in which rick valicente will presents his graphic imagery [in blue] through video, projections and words.  / for information and tickets contact the alberta college of art extension department 1407-14 avenue NW calgary, alberta TZN 4R3 / Centered below in a variety of fonts: 7 mar 19 one / 8 where? eight pm in the alberta college of art lecture hall tel 403.284.7640 fax 403. 289.6682 tickets $12 student tickets $8 [two blue arrows below point to the prices]
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description:
Recto: Poster design comprised of two sections. Above, printed in brown, a bomber airplane with four engines fllying from left to right. Below, printed in blue, a large sphere covered entirely in newsprint. Across image in yellow, distorted brackets surround "DE" in red which is printed with extended spacing followed by "ja" [in white] and "vu" in red.
Verso: Against a background printed in pale blue of a close up of a piece of satin-like material, large light blue and gray block letters in upper quadrant spell: hate / kills / love. In blue and black at center in black brackets "im er ur luv. Vertically, down center of sheet a large cross is supperimposed on text. Below cross at right: march 31 is easter.

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, "Déja vu by now man (not so) kind should know...", ca. 1985.
ca. 1985. Offset lithograph on textured white wove paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-226.
